Insert power plug and turn on; place safety key; press MODE to select manual mode; press START; treadmill counts down 5 seconds with beeps, then starts gently and accelerates to set speed.

Press the 'stop' key at any time to stop the motor from running; you can also pull out the safety key to stop the treadmill immediately.

Pull off the safety key; press 'PROGRAM' and 'MODE' keys at the same time; display shows 0.6 for kilometers to miles, 1.0 for miles to kilometers.

Speed instant keys; in the running state, directly set the speed to the specified value of the key.
QUICK INCLINE keys set the treadmill incline directly to the specified value (6 or 9) during running.
Distance and time are shown in the 'DISTANCE' and 'TIME' window; calories in the 'CALORIES' window; incline in the 'INCLINE' window; pulse in the 'PULSE' window; speed in the 'SPEED' window.
The speed or incline adjustment is valid only in the current segment; when switching to a new segment, the program settings resume and three beeps sound.
After 10 segments run, the motor stops automatically with a long stop prompt sound.
When the motor is running, press the 'START' key to switch between pause and running; restarting in a suspended state preserves recorded running data and processes.
ERP mode is a power-saving mode enabled by default; the console enters sleep state after about 4.5 minutes of no operation.
In standby mode, press and hold the MODE button for about 3 seconds to display ‘2222’ to cancel (turn off) ERP; long press again for about 3 seconds to display ‘1111’ to return (turn on) ERP mode.
The console will show 'OIL' after running a distance of 300 km; lubricate the belt as indicated, then press any key for 6 seconds to clear the warning and reset the distance.
Treadmill; Manual; Safety key; Silicon oil; Wrench; Cross Wrench 14×17×75

Take treadmill out of box; turn out foot folding rod from underside of running deck with foot; lift stand post directly when stepping on foot folding rod; after lifting stand post, hold handle bar with one hand and pull up monitor tray with other hand; pull up monitor to suitable position; treadmill is now unfolded.
Turn off the power; raise the treadmill to an upright position; to lower, hold the treadmill with your hands, step on the iron hook with your feet, and slowly lower it to the ground.
Do not strike after standing up.
Cut off the power before moving the treadmill.

Turn on power; turn on power switch; after display is normal, press 'Program' to select an automatic running mode; press 'Start' to begin; treadmill runs automatically according to selected mode.
Yes; use the speed quick key to quickly enter the running speed you need while running.
After the motor stops, incline the treadmill to a certain height and adjust the rear feet pad.

Pull out the plug when meet with power failure suddenly, may cause accident and injury when power resumption.
Hold the plug, not the wire, when pulling out the plug; pull out the power plug gently from the socket; do not pull out or insert the plug with wet hands.
No, do not open motor and roller cover unless professionals.
Do not use the treadmill after meals or when tired; may cause damage to your health.
The treadmill is intended for home use; it cannot be used in school or gymnasium where there are lots of unspecific users.

Patients under treatment for backache, leg/waist/neck injuries, numbness, chronic diseases (intervertebral disc protrusion, spinal slip, cervical vertebra protrusion), deformational arthritis, rheumatism, gout, osteoporosis, circulatory system issues (heart disease, vascular disorders, hypertension), respiratory disturbance, artificial heart rhythm problems, malignant tumors, thrombosis, diabetes with perceptual disturbance, skin injury, high fever above 38℃, bent backbone, pregnancy or menstrual period, discomfort, obviously bad condition, rehabilitation purposes, abnormal physical features; these individuals should consult a professional doctor before use.

Press the PROGRAM key to select the BMI program; press the MODE key to select the item number; use the + and - keys to set the parameters; after setting, place your hands on the heart rate sensors and wait 4 seconds for the result.
F1: Sex; range 1-2; 1=male, 2=female; F2: Age; range 1-99 years; F3: Height; range 100-220CM (39-87 inch); F4: Weight; range 20-150KG (44-330 lb)
Fat less than 18 is thin; 18-24 is ideal body weight; 25-28 is overweight; greater than 29 is obese (Asian standard)
Turn off the power and pull out the plug when you finish exercising.

At stop, START begins a 5-second countdown and starts the treadmill; during running, pressing START switches between pause and running, preserving running data and processes when paused.
Pressing STOP during running slows down the motor smoothly until it stops and returns all settings to the default state.

Connect power plug to grounded socket; ensure treadmill is stable; check if function is normal; stand on side rails when starting; clip safety key to clothes; prepare with left leg before running; only one person allowed; overload exercise prohibited.

Keep power cord away from hot objects; do not damage, twist, or put heavy things on it; do not operate with wet hands; do not pull out or insert the plug with wet hands; hold the plug, not the wire, when pulling out; keep the power plug away from needle, waste, or water; pull out the plug gently from the socket.
Stop using immediately; pull out the plug; make a trouble call, may cause electric shock and injury.
Anyrun; Kinomap; Zwift
Turn on device's Bluetooth; log in Anyrun APP, go to Settings → Device Management, find and select the device; click Bluetooth name to connect; console will display Bluetooth symbol when connected.

Login Zwift APP on mobile; select running speed in running on the matching device page; click Matching; select SW-XXXXXX-XXXX (the number on the console) on the search page and press OK; select YOUR SPEED on the 'What's YOUR SPEED' page and press OK; select route and training mode, then click 'Run'; console synchronizes data with Zwift during movement.
Bluetooth cannot be connected to the console under the page of engineering mode.
Turn on Bluetooth on your smartphone; click 'RUN MUSIC'; connect successfully
Place 8mm wrench on left belt tension bolt and turn clockwise 1/4 turn; repeat for right bolt; turn both bolts same number of turns; repeat until slipping is eliminated; do not overtighten.
Turn both belt tension bolts counter-clockwise the same number of turns.

Start treadmill without anyone on it, set speed to 6km/h; observe belt position; if left, turn left adjustment bolt clockwise 1/4 turn and right bolt counterclockwise 1/4; if right, turn right adjustment bolt clockwise 1/4 turn and left bolt counterclockwise 1/4; repeat until centered; increase speed to 13km/h to verify smooth running.
13kph
Check lubrication every 3 months; use oil free silicon spray.

Position the belt so the seam is in the middle of the plate; insert the spray valve in the spray head; lift one side of the belt and spray from front to back for about 4 seconds; repeat on the other side; wait 1 minute before starting the machine.
Wipe the console and other surfaces with a clean soft and damp cloth to remove sweat residues.
Store your treadmill in a clean and dry environment; ensure the master power switch is off and unplugged from the electrical wall outlet.
Check and reconnect the speed sensor; replace the speed sensor if defective; check and reconnect or clean dust/grease on speed sensor; replace the controller if needed.
Reconnect the communication cable and check if the terminal is connected well or replace the communication cable; replace the console; replace the controller

E-02 indicates defective motor cable and motor; poor connection between motor cable and controller or defective controller; resolved by replacing the motor, checking and connecting cables well or replacing the controller.
E-05 indicates: controller is damaged; damaged motor; mechanical failure
Check and connect or replace the handle pulse cables; Replace the console
Press any key to wake up the system from ERP sleep.

Do not jump up or down from the treadmill when running, may fall down and get injury.
Reserve the silicon bottle to some place that children cannot reach
Do not operate with wet hands; may cause electric shock or injury.
Disassemble, repair, change by customer themselves are forbid absolutely; may cause mechanical breakdown and injury.
Turn off the power before folding the unit.
Connect the power plug to a socket with a grounded circuit; the socket must have a special circuit not shared with other electrical equipment; ensure the treadmill is stable on the ground before use.
Keep less indoor dust and a certain extent of humidity to avoid interference of console and controller.
